intro: Cryptantha fastigiata, commonly known as the tall cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color and bloom in late spring to early summer. Cryptantha fastigiata is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe.
